results.title: Statins, commonly coprescribed drugs, and concomitant risk factors: A protective, neutral, or harmful association with common cancer types development: A 10-year multicentric retrospective lebanese study
results.text_hl: A harmful association with the development of @<m>DISEASE_Lung_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008175 @@@lung and bladder cancer@@@ was found with the increasing duration of intake of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin is beneficial to lung cancer progression by inducing METTL3-induced m6A modification on EZH2 mRNA.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To elucidate the molecular mechanism of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ on inhibiting malignant progression of @<m>DISEASE_Lung_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008175 @@@lung cancer@@@.

results.title: Statins Decrease Programmed Death-Ligand 1 (PD-L1) by Inhibiting AKT and beta-Catenin Signaling
results.text_hl: Significant decreased phosphorylation of @GENE_CTNNB1 @GENE_1499 @@@beta-catenin@@@-S552 was observed in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated @<m>DISEASE_Lung_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008175 @@@lung cancer@@@ (@CELLLINE_CVCL:0608 @@@Calu-1@@@) and @DISEASE_Melanoma @DISEASE_MESH:D008545 @@@melanoma@@@ (@CELLLINE_CVCL:0132 @@@A375@@@) cells in a dose-dependent manner (Figure 5A).

results.title: Anti-cancer mechanisms of linalool and 1,8-cineole in non-small cell lung cancer A549 cells
results.text_hl: The combination of each @CHEMICAL_Monoterpenes @CHEMICAL_MESH:D039821 @@@monoterpene@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ increased the G0/G1 cell cycle arrest and sensitized cells to apoptosis compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ alone.

results.title: Statins dose-dependently exert a chemopreventive effect against lung cancer in COPD patients: a population-based cohort study
results.text_hl: By contrast, @<m>DISEASE_Lung_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008175 @@@lung cancer@@@ risk in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ using @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ was significantly lower than that in statin nonusers (aHRs = 0.41, 0.44, 0.52, and 0.58, respectively).

results.title: Effects of simvastatin on cell viability and proinflammatory pathways in lung adenocarcinoma cells exposed to hydrogen peroxide
results.text_hl: Within such a research context, it is noteworthy to point out that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ was able to induce a comprehensive inhibition of many phenomena related to @<m>DISEASE_Lung_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008175 @@@lung cancer@@@.
